title: My microphone volume is low on Firefox
content: Everything works fine on my pc but for some reason when I try to use my microphone on any site (Like: WhatsApp voice notes, Telegram voice notes) my microphone volume is too low. Then I tried it on another browser (Chrome) and it worked just fine. I also tried to check all the settings and everything was fine. I also tried to "Refresh Firefox" basically resetting it and it still didn't fix my problem. I would really appreciate it if you could help me fix this problem because I really love Firefox and love using it but this is a major problem for me... Thanks in advance
creator: TheGamesGhost

title: How to open files without downloading them after version 98
content:
Hello. I am extremely annoyed with Mozilla after this update and am DESPERATE for a fix.

I am a college student. I have to open several notes, lectures, syllabi, sample assignments, etc. a day. Obviously, I can't download every single one of these files to my computer. I'd run out of space. The SOLE REASON why I picked Firefox as my browser was because of the dialogue box that appeared whenever I went to download something, giving me the option to simply open a file without saving it.

They made it so that dialog box wasn't the default. Okay, fine, annoying. But all I have to do is go into settings and change it to "Always ask," right? Wrong. EVERY SINGLE FILE GETS DOWNLOADED TO MY COMPUTER NOW. Every PDF and MS Word document is sent straight to my download folder.

Is there ANY way I can open up files (specifically PDF and MS Word files) without saving them to my computer? I remember these files would be saved to a "temporary" file area, how can I re enable that again? If not, I will be switching to another browser that offers this option.
creator: beaunathanhoward

title: Download file vs open file
content: Hi I have Mozilla set to download file in c:/temp I also have a set for torrent files to be opened with Bittorrent, instead of downloading them. Bittorrent is set to save torrent files in C:/torrents But when i click a torrent Mozilla first wil save my torrent file in C:.temp and than open automaticallly Bittorent wich will save my torrent file also in c:/torrents. I use Mozilla for over 10 yrs, this behaviour occurs since last update, before this update when clicking a torrent file Mozilla dont download anything but let Bittorent to open and manage that file. Is this a bug or just a setting i missÂ ? Is very annoing

title: Small white bar stuck at the bottom of the screen.
content: There's this tiny white bar stuck at the bottom of the screen (only a couple pixels high) whenever I'm in full screen on Firefox. It doesn't happen with other browsers or any other application but it's really starting to annoy me whenever I'm on a dark page. I have my taskbar hidden and just on the bottom edge of the screen are a few pixels of white that wont go away. It might be a little hard to see on the snip cause it's so small but its genuinely really annoying when I'm on any site or watching anything.FYI I've already tried to troubleshooting restart and completely wiped my Firefox, default settings and it's still there. Any help would really be appreciated.

title: How do I disable the new download notification?

I found that this latest update ruined firefox even further because now every single time I download an image, it pops the stupid download list on top of everything till I click somewhere instead of silently downloading like it used to do. I found no options at all for disabling this new terrible feature that you for some reason forced on us against our will yet again.

title: PDFs in new tab instead current tab
content:
Hi, I have not changed any settings but since a few days ago, any PDF links or downloads are shown on the same tab instead of a new tab. Is there any way to go back to opening in new tabs?

To clarify, for example, I receive a pdf file from web whatsapp, and I open it. Previously, a new tab is created showing the pdf file I received. However, now, the pdf file is shown on the tab where web whatsapp was instead of opening a new tab. I have to click go back one page to navigate back web whatsapp.

title: Firefox takes a long time to be responsive on first start
content:
I'm having the exact same problem that 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1157490

firefox itself opens and loads within seconds perfectly fine,[...] But when I try to go to any website, it takes ages to load and function normally. [...]

Once it has loaded the website(s) it functions completely normally

As the solution in that thread was a full format I'm reopening this to find a more precise solution.

I tried everything on that thread without success. Deactivated every plug-in and the problem persist. Running in safe-mode corrects the problem.

I attach an image of the profiler (I can send the full profile if needed)
creator: joseluismx33

title: Some douche nerd always have to chime in that it's probably one of your add ons or extensions every time someone posts about a Firefox problem?
content: Why does some douche nerd always have to chime in that it's probably one of your add ons or extensions every time someone posts about a Firefox problem? Maybe Mozilla needs to check add ons more carefully before putting them in their repositories! Most cases have been some Firefox setting malfunction for most of my Firefox issues! It's a programmer flaw not extensions I use, especially since I haven't added any new ones in forever and only update them if they quit working! If it ain't broke don't fix it! Also Firefox needs to stop changing my settings to default on updates! I had my settings the way I did because I finally figured out how to get Firefox to run smoothy with audio/video and it isn't with the default settings for those. I am constantly having to untick use recommended performance settings and hardware acceleration. I also have to go through security and privacy settings and set them the way I like them and which cookies etc. Leave the settings the way I had them! Is there a way to export my settings to a file and when Mozilla f*cks it all up for me import them from that file? Please make unticked for email me when someone answers the thread. Thanks.
creator: nunya_fukkin_bizness
